.
Handling a Veteran's Request for a Hearing
Upon request, the Veteran is entitled to a hearing to introduce, in person, any available evidence believed to be pertinent in connection with the proposed adverse action.
If the Veteran’s request for a hearing is received within 30 days of the date of the notice of proposed adverse action,
continue the EP, and
do
not
adjust the Veteran’s award until either
the hearing is held, any evidence requested as a result of the hearing is received or deemed unobtainable, and a final rating decision is made, or
the Veteran fails to appear for the hearing without good cause.
Reference
:  For more information on what action to take when a hearing is requested, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 3.B
.
